channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Trump's first 100 days has meant for these truck drivers and sex workers

item.title: Big Lots to reopen 132 stores in May. Here's where.
item.description: Big Lots, which once looked headed for the retail scrap heap, now plans to expand in more than a dozen states.

item.title: Canada will deal with Trump 'on our terms', Carney tells BBC
item.description: Speaking exclusively to the BBC, Canada's PM says he will only visit the US when there is a "serious discussion to be had".

item.title: Gaza medic detained during deadly Israeli attack released, Red Crescent says
item.description: Assad al-Nassasra was missing for weeks following last month's attack, in which 15 emergency workers were killed by Israeli troops.

item.title: Man accused of Kim Kardashian Paris robbery 'regrets' $10m heist
item.description: The reality star was tied up and robbed at gunpoint at a luxury Paris hotel in 2016.

item.title: For some Americans, the end of the Vietnam War after Saigon fell 50 years ago is still deeply felt
item.description: The Vietnam War that ended after the fall of Saigon 50 years ago greatly impacted U.S. society. For some Americans, it still shapes their lives today.

item.title: Pressure mounts to probe Kenya police and army after BBC exposé
item.description: A BBC investigation identifies members of the security forces who shot dead protesters last June.

item.title: Three people killed after shooting in Sweden
item.description: The incident took place at a hair salon in the town of Uppsala, Swedish media report.

item.title: Is Trump any closer to eliminating taxes on tips?

item.description: Trump administration plans to ease some tariffs on automakers; Florida man jumps into alligator-inhabited lake to save injured bald eagle.
